Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Hello everyone,

We are working on tuning the 30-something parameters for HyperNEAT (2.6 in
our case) and we are looking for hard problems that do not take too much
computational effort, which means a run can take about 15 minutes. We
already tried most of the problems supplied with HyperNEAT, but most of them
proved to be either too simple (near-optimal fitness within a few
generations) or too expensive to run (one run can take hours). In this
context a run is a complete run of HyperNEAT with n generations, not the
evaluation of 1 generation. We cut back on the number of generations
(default is 300), so problems that take 30-45 minutes for a whole run are
also ok.

Our interest lies only in using our tool to tune the parameters, so we won't
use the source code of the experiments for anything other than parameter
tuning and we will hand our results (e.g. parameters and best performance)
back to you in exchange for letting us use your work (provided we got to
tuning your problem). As a result of this work, we hope to be able to
release validated tuning software for use with HyperNEAT.

Regards,
Jan van der Lugt

--0016e6db2d7bfdac100495663dbe
